intro: Oenothera hamata, commonly known as the stiffstem evening primrose, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Onagraceae family and is characterized by its hairy stems and yellow to orange flowers that bloom in the evening. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are linear and often covered in fine hairs, which help reduce water loss. Oenothera hamata is also known for its medicinal properties, with its seeds containing essential fatty acids.
